description.narrative: To improve child and maternal care behavior, and increase utilization of key micronutrients, in order to contribute to improving the nutritional status of vulnerable groups.

condition.narrative: Complete the registration process for registration of zinc as an essential drug with the Drug Administration and Control Authority
Establish, by July 7, 2009, the National Nutrition Coordinating Body.
Furnish to IDA evidence satisfactory to IDA, demonstrating that universal salt iodization regulations following ProclamationNo.200/2000 have been adopted and are effectively in force
Jointly review, in conjunction with IDA and other Program Partners, by March 31 of each year during implementation, commencing inEFY 2001, all matters relating to the progress of the Project/Program
Retain or recruit external auditor to carry out the audit described in Section II (B) (3) of Schedule 2 to FA

title.narrative: Percentage of CBN woredas providing monthly nutrition data to federal level
Percentage of health personnel trained to masters level in nutrition (of a target of 30)
Percentage of NNP operational research studies completed and disseminated (of a target of 10)

comment.narrative: (8 of a possible 10 studies to be considered)

title.narrative: Zinc registered as essential drug and included in Health Post package
Percentage of national salt production iodized in previous year

comment.narrative: FMOH routine reports (revised indicator definition and baseline value)

title.narrative: Percentage of pregnant women receiving iron and folate supplementation

comment.narrative: Source: National Nutrition Survey (NNS) 2009 (baseline value and data source revised

title.narrative: Establishment of inter-sectoral National Nutrition Coordination Body (source: Terms of Reference for body, Annual NNP Program Reports, project evaluations; baseline 2007)
Universal Salt Iodization policy adopted and put in force, supporting Proclamation 200/2000

comment.narrative: The universal salt iodization policy legislated on February 18, 2011, came into force on April 13, 2011
